Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PMAP-36(1â€“20) (fragment of PMAP-36, synthetic AMPs, Lys-rich, Arg-rich, UCLL1c, XXA; BBMm)
Sequence Information.Source: sequence truncation, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (57.14%) toBMAP-18K=R: 30%; L=G: 10%.Activity: active against E. coli 25922 (MIC 32 uM), E.coli 1005 (MIC 128 uM), S.typhimurium 7731 (MIC 128 uM), S.aureus 29213 (MIC 128 uM), S.epidermidis 12228 (MIC 128 uM), S.faecalis 29212 (MIC 128 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (150 mM salt); KCl-insensitive:E. coli (4.5 mM salt); NH4Cl-insensitive:E. coli (6 uM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (1 mM salt); ZnCl2-insensitive:E. coli (8 uM salt); FeCl3-insensitive:E. coli (4 uM salt).Structure: random coil in PBS and helical in 50% TFE or 30 mM SDS micelles.In vitro toxicity: human RBC, 5% hemolysis >256 uM, not hemo.lytic.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: permeated bacterial membranes.
Literature Information.Author: Zhu X, Dong N, Wang Z, Ma Z, Zhang L, Ma Q, Shan A.2014
Literature Information.Title: Design of imperfectly amphipathic alpha-helical antimicrobial peptides with enhanced cell selectivity.
